enumDefs.name: TermAssignmentStatus
enumDefs.description: TermAssignmentStatus defines how much the semantic assignment should be trusted.

elementDefs.description: DISCOVERED means that the semantic assignment was added by a discovery engine.
PROPOSED means that the semantic assignment was proposed by person - they may be a subject matter expert, or consumer of the Referenceable asset
IMPORTED means that the semantic assignment has been imported from outside of the open metadata cluster
VALIDATED means that the semantic assignment has been reviewed and is highly trusted.
DEPRECATED means that the semantic assignment is being phased out. There may be another semantic assignment to the Referenceable that will ultimately replace this one.
OBSOLETE means that the semantic assignment is no longer in use,
OTHER means that the semantic assignment value does not match any of the other Term Assignment Status values

relationshipDefs.name: SemanticAssignment
relationshipDefs.description: SemanticAssignment is a relationship used to assign a term to a referenceable object. This means that the term describes the meaning of the referenceable object. The semantic assignment needs to be a controlled relationship when glossary definitions are used to provide classifications for the data assets and hence define how the data is to be governed.

attributeDefs.name: description
attributeDefs.description: The description field can be used to add details about the semantic assignment.

attributeDefs.name: confidence
attributeDefs.description: The confidence attribute in the semantic assignment stores the level of confidence (0-100%) in the correctness of the semantic assignment - it is typically used by discovery engines.

attributeDefs.name: createdBy
attributeDefs.description: The semantic assignment is created by the user (person or engine) identified by the createdBy attribute.

attributeDefs.name: steward
attributeDefs.description: The steward is the person responsible for assessing the semantic assignment and deciding if it should be approved or not.
